title: (x) Intro geometric slab serif - Memphis {Raph}
content:
Can anyone identify this subtext font? Sorry about the low quality of the image.

Thanks.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [INTRO.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906232356/http:/typophile.com/files/INTRO.png) | 10.68 KB |

 [‹ (x) Which weight of Balantines Script is this? - Regular {Patricia}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906232356/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38794 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) SuperBrugsen corporate sans - custom face by Jonas Hecksher (e-Types AS) {Asparouh Kalyandjiev} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906232356/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38270 "Go to next forum topic")
author: MatthewSchnepf

comments.content:
I think it’s [Memphis Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906232356/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/memphis/light/), but it’s also possible it’s [Rockwell Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906232356/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/rockwell-mt-2/rockwell-light/).

_Bows_

Is this possibly from [German music magazine ‘Intro’](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906232356/http:/www.intro.de/)?  
Anyhow, they use [ITC Lubalin Graph](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906232356/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-lubalin-graph/) in various weights.

Not Rockwell nor ITC Lubalin Graph, it’s [Memphis Light](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906232356/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=memphis&site=d&btnG=Go&sample_text=Jane%20Rice-Bowen%2C%20Chief%20Executive&sample_size=16) indeed.

Yes, agreed. Definitely Memphis Light.

Thank you!
